sen.j: 柴田 承桂（しばた しょうけい、嘉永3年5月12日 (旧暦)（1850年6月21日）-明治43年（1910年）8月2日）は、明治の化学者、薬学者。
sen.e: Shokei SHIBATA (June 21, 1850 - August 2, 1910) was a chemist and pharmacologist in the Meiji period.
Shokei SHIBATA (June 21, 1850 - August 2, 1910) was a chemist and pharmacologist in the Meiji period.
Shokei SHIBATA (June 21, 1850 - August 2, 1910) was a chemist and pharmacologist in the Meiji period.

sen.j: 柴田桂太・柴田雄次の父。
sen.e: He was father of Keita SHIBATA and Yuji SHIBATA.
He was the father of Keita SHIBATA and Yuji SHIBATA.
sen.cmt: fatherの前にtheを追加しました。
sen.e: He was the father of Keita SHIBATA and Yuji SHIBATA.

sen.j: 略歴
sen.e: Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History

sen.j: 漢方医である永坂周二の次男として名古屋に生まれる。
sen.e: Shokei SHIBATA was the second son of Shuji NAGASAKA, who was a Chinese medicine doctor, and was born in Nagoya.
Shokei SHIBATA was born in Nagoya as the second son of Shuji NAGASAKA, who was a Chinese medicine doctor.
sen.cmt: 流れをよくするため、以下のように変更しました。Shokei SHIBATA was born in Nagoya as the second son of Shuji NAGASAKA, who was a Chinese medicine doctor.
sen.e: Shokei SHIBATA was born in Nagoya as the second son of Shuji NAGASAKA, who was a Chinese medicine doctor.

sen.j: 弟に歌人・書家永坂石埭（ながさか せきたい）がある。
sen.e: He had a younger brother, Sekitai NAGASAKA, who was a kajin (poet) and calligrapher.
He had a younger brother, Sekitai NAGASAKA, who was a kajin (poet) and calligrapher.
He had a younger brother, Sekitai NAGASAKA, who was a kajin (poet) and calligrapher.

sen.j: 尾張藩医柴田承慶の養子となり柴田家を継ぐが、承桂は医師を志さず、化学者、薬学者の道を選ぶ。
sen.e: Shokei was the adopted child of Shokei SHIBATA (柴田承慶), who was a doctor in the Owari Domain, and inherited the SHIBATA family property, but rather than become a doctor, he decided on a career as a chemist and pharmacologist.
sen.cmt: 柴田承慶＝読み方が柴田承桂（しばたしょうけい）と同じで、混合しやすく、区別の仕方が不明。
sen.e: Shokei was the adopted child of Shokei SHIBATA (柴田承慶), who was a doctor in the Owari Domain, and inherited the SHIBATA family property, but rather than become a doctor, he decided on a career as a chemist and pharmacologist.

Shokei was the adopted child of Shokei SHIBATA (柴田承慶), who was a doctor in the Owari Domain, and inherited the SHIBATA family property, but rather than become a doctor, he decided on a career as a chemist and pharmacologist.

sen.j: 明治2年（1869年）、尾張藩に選ばれて大学東校貢進生となった。
sen.e: In 1869, he was recommended by the Owari Domain and became a koshinsei (government supported student) at Daigaku Toko (the predecessor of the Faculty of Medicine, University of Tokyo).
sen.cmt: 貢進生=「a koshinsei (government supported student)」定訳不明。
sen.e: In 1869, he was recommended by the Owari Domain and became a koshinsei (government supported student) at Daigaku Toko (the predecessor of the Faculty of Medicine, University of Tokyo).
In 1869, he was recommended by the Owari Domain and became a koshinsei (government supported student) at Daigaku Toko (the predecessor of the Faculty of Medicine, University of Tokyo).

sen.j: 2年後、文部省の命令でドイツに留学し、ベルリン大学のホフマンの下で有機化学を学び、ついでミュンヘン大学で薬学・衛生学を学んだ。
sen.e: Two years later, the Ministry of Education ordered Shokei to go to Germany to study organic chemistry under August Wilhelm von Hofmann, who was at the Humboldt University of Berlin, after which Shokei studied pharmacy and hygienics at the Ludwig Maximilian University of Munich.

Two years later, the Ministry of Education ordered Shokei to go to Germany to study organic chemistry under August Wilhelm von Hofmann, who was at the Humboldt University of Berlin, after which Shokei studied pharmacy and hygienics at the Ludwig Maximilian University of Munich.

Two years later, the Ministry of Education ordered Shokei to go to Germany to study organic chemistry under August Wilhelm von Hofmann, who was at the Humboldt University of Berlin, after which Shokei studied pharmacy and hygienics at the Ludwig Maximilian University of Munich.

sen.j: 明治7年（1874年）に帰国して、東京医学校の初代製薬学科教授に就任する。
sen.e: He came back in 1874, and became the first professor of the Department of medicine manufacturing at the Tokyo Igakko (Tokyo Medical School).
He came back in 1874, and became the first professor of the Department of medicine manufacturing at the Tokyo Igakko (Tokyo Medical School).
He came back in 1874, and became the first professor of the Department of medicine manufacturing at the Tokyo Igakko (Tokyo Medical School).

sen.j: 『百科全書』の翻訳事業に参加して「地質学」「果園篇」「太古史」の翻訳を担当した（「太古史」は、日本に初めて考古学の紹介をすることとなる）。
sen.e: He joined the translation project of "Hyakkazensho (Encyclopedia, or systematic dictionary of the sciences, arts, and crafts)" and was in charge of translation of 'geology,' 'compilation of orchardry' and 'history of ancient time' (which introduced the subject of archaeology to Japan for the first time).
sen.cmt: 「果園篇」= 'compilation of orchardry' 定訳不明。
sen.e: He joined the translation project of "Hyakkazensho (Encyclopedia, or systematic dictionary of the sciences, arts, and crafts)" and was in charge of translation of 'geology,' 'orchardry' and 'history of ancient time' (which introduced the subject of archaeology to Japan for the first time).
sen.cmt: 「果園篇」= 'compilation of orchardry' 定訳不明。ということなので、文脈から、orchardryと略しました。
sen.e: He joined the translation project of "Hyakkazensho (Encyclopedia, or systematic dictionary of the sciences, arts, and crafts)" and was in charge of translation of 'geology,' 'orchardry' and 'history of ancient time' (which introduced the subject of archaeology to Japan for the first time).

sen.j: その後、文部省衛生局司薬監督、東京・大阪両司薬場長を歴任するが病気がちのために退官して、以後著述活動に専念した。
sen.e: After that, he successively filled posts as director of Shiyaku (medical and pharmaceutical test) in the Health and Medical Bureau of the Ministry of Education and manager of both the Tokyo Shiyakujo and Osaka Shiyakujo (national medical and pharmaceutical products test laboratory organization), but retired from that work because he was prone to illness and after that, he devoted himself to literary work.

After that, he successively filled posts as director of Shiyaku (medical and pharmaceutical test) in the Health and Medical Bureau of the Ministry of Education and manager of both the Tokyo Shiyakujo and Osaka Shiyakujo (national medical and pharmaceutical products test laboratory organization), but retired from that work because he was prone to illness and after that, he devoted himself to literary work.

After that, he successively filled posts as director of Shiyaku (medical and pharmaceutical test) in the Health and Medical Bureau of the Ministry of Education and manager of both the Tokyo Shiyakujo and Osaka Shiyakujo (national medical and pharmaceutical products test laboratory organization), but retired from that work because he was prone to illness and after that, he devoted himself to literary work.

sen.j: また、当時既に官職にはなかったが明治19年（1886年）制定の薬局方日本薬局方および改正日本薬局方（明治24年（1891年））の編纂に携わった。
sen.e: In addition, although he was no longer in a government post, he was still engaged in compiling the Japanese Pharmacopoeia, which was enacted in 1886, and the revision of the Japanese Pharmacopoeia in 1891.
sen.cmt: 原文「薬局方日本薬局方」を「日本薬局方」のみで訳出。
sen.e: In addition, although he was no longer in a government post, he was still engaged in compiling the Japanese Pharmacopoeia, which was enacted in 1886, and the revision of the Japanese Pharmacopoeia in 1891.

In addition, although he was no longer in a government post, he was still engaged in compiling the Japanese Pharmacopoeia, which was enacted in 1886, and the revision of the Japanese Pharmacopoeia in 1891.

sen.j: 明治36年（1903年）薬学博士。
sen.e: He became a Doctor of Pharmacology in 1903.
He became a Doctor of Pharmacology in 1903.
He became a Doctor of Pharmacology in 1903.

sen.j: 墓は東京都新宿区の幸国寺と名古屋市千種区の大法寺に分骨されている。
sen.e: His cremated body was divided into two portions and entombed separately in Koukotsu-ji Temple in Shinjuku, Tokyo and Daiho-ji Temple in Chikusa-ku (Ward), Nagoya City.
His cremated body was divided into two portions and entombed separately in Koukotsu-ji Temple in Shinjuku, Tokyo and Daiho-ji Temple in Chikusa-ku (Ward), Nagoya City.
His cremated body was divided into two portions and entombed separately in Koukotsu-ji Temple in Shinjuku, Tokyo and Daiho-ji Temple in Chikusa-ku (Ward), Nagoya City.

sen.j: 著作
sen.e: Literary work
Literary work
Literary work

sen.j: 柴田承桂の著作は以下のとおり。
sen.e: Shokei SHIBATA's literary works are as shown below.
Shokei SHIBATA's literary works are as shown below.
Shokei SHIBATA's literary works are as shown below.

sen.j: ファルク著、柴田承桂訳『普魯士学校規則』文部省、1877年
sen.e: "Puroshia Gakkou Kisoku (Prussia School regulations)" written by Adalbert FALK, translated by Shokei SHIBATA, published by the Ministry of Education in 1877
"Puroshia Gakkou Kisoku (Prussia School regulations)" written by Adalbert FALK, translated by Shokei SHIBATA, published by the Ministry of Education in 1877
"Puroshia Gakkou Kisoku (Prussia School regulations)" written by Adalbert FALK, translated by Shokei SHIBATA, published by the Ministry of Education in 1877

sen.j: 柴田承桂訳編『衛生概論』島村利助、丸屋善七、1879-1882年
sen.e: "Eisei Gairon (Introduction to Hygiene)" written by Risuke SHIMAMURA and Zenshichi MARUYA, translated and edited by Shokei SHIBATA in 1879-1882
"Eisei Gairon (Introduction to Hygiene)" written by Risuke SHIMAMURA and Zenshichi MARUYA, translated and edited by Shokei SHIBATA in 1879-1882
"Eisei Gairon (Introduction to Hygiene)" written by Risuke SHIMAMURA and Zenshichi MARUYA, translated and edited by Shokei SHIBATA in 1879-1882

sen.j: 飯盛挺造編、丹波敬三、柴田承桂校補『物理学』島村利助、丸屋善七、1879-1882年
sen.e: "Butsurigaku (Physics)" written by Risuke SHIMAMURA and Zenshichi MARUYA, edited by Teizo IIMORI, proofread and assisted by Keizo TANBA and Shokei SHIBATA in 1879-1882
"Butsurigaku (Physics)" written by Risuke SHIMAMURA and Zenshichi MARUYA, edited by Teizo IIMORI, proofread and assisted by Keizo TANBA and Shokei SHIBATA in 1879-1882
"Butsurigaku (Physics)" written by Risuke SHIMAMURA and Zenshichi MARUYA, edited by Teizo IIMORI, proofread and assisted by Keizo TANBA and Shokei SHIBATA in 1879-1882

sen.j: ノイバウヱル著、下山順一郎訳、柴田承桂校補『検尿法』下山順一郎、1881年
sen.e: "Kennyoho (The Method of Urinalysis)" authored by Karl Theodor Ludwing NEUBAUER, translated by Junichiro SHIMOYAMA, proofread and assisted by Shokei SHIBATA, written by Junichiro SHIMOYAMA in 1881
"Kennyoho (The Method of Urinalysis)" authored by Karl Theodor Ludwing NEUBAUER, translated by Junichiro SHIMOYAMA, proofread and assisted by Shokei SHIBATA, written by Junichiro SHIMOYAMA in 1881
"Kennyoho (The Method of Urinalysis)" authored by Karl Theodor Ludwing NEUBAUER, translated by Junichiro SHIMOYAMA, proofread and assisted by Shokei SHIBATA, written by Junichiro SHIMOYAMA in 1881

sen.j: フリードリヒ・サンデル、柴田承桂訳、長與專齋校閲『公衆衛生論』竹雲書屋、1882年
sen.e: "Koshu Eisei Ron (The Theory of Public Health)" written by Friedrich SANDEL, translated by Shokei SHIBATA, revised by Sensai NAGAYO, published by Chikuunshooku in 1882
"Koshu Eisei Ron (The Theory of Public Health)" written by Friedrich SANDEL, translated by Shokei SHIBATA, revised by Sensai NAGAYO, published by Chikuunshooku in 1882
"Koshu Eisei Ron (The Theory of Public Health)" written by Friedrich SANDEL, translated by Shokei SHIBATA, revised by Sensai NAGAYO, published by Chikuunshooku in 1882

sen.j: 丹波敬三、柴田承桂編、高松数馬補『普通動物学』島村利助、丸屋善七、1883年
sen.e: "Futsu Dobutsu Gaku (General Zoology) " written by Risuke SHIMAMURA and Zenshichi MARUYA, edited by Keizo TANBA and Shokei SHIBATA, assisted by Kazuma TAKAMATSU in 1883
"Futsu Dobutsu Gaku (General Zoology) " written by Risuke SHIMAMURA and Zenshichi MARUYA, edited by Keizo TANBA and Shokei SHIBATA, assisted by Kazuma TAKAMATSU in 1883
"Futsu Dobutsu Gaku (General Zoology) " written by Risuke SHIMAMURA and Zenshichi MARUYA, edited by Keizo TANBA and Shokei SHIBATA, assisted by Kazuma TAKAMATSU in 1883

sen.j: 伊藤謙著、柴田承桂、村井純之助校補『薬品名彙』増訂、島村利助、丸屋善七、1883年
sen.e: "Yakuhin Meii (List of Medicine Names)" new and revised edition, written by Risuke SHIMAMURA and Zenshichi MARUYA, proofread and assisted by Yuzuru ITO, Shokei SHIBATA and Junnosuke MURAI in 1883

sen.e: "Rinsho Yakusetsu (The Theory of Clinical Drugs)" written by Shuji NAGASAKA, edited by Jyugoro ISE and Shokei SHIBATA in 1884
"Rinsho Yakusetsu (The Theory of Clinical Drugs)" written by Shuji NAGASAKA, edited by Jyugoro ISE and Shokei SHIBATA in 1884

sen.e: "Inryo Sui (Drinking Water)" written by Risuke SHIMAMURA, edited by Hidematsu TAKAHASHI and Shokei SHIBATA, proofread and assisted by Shu IKUTA in 1887

sen.cmt: 予防の意味ではpreventionの方がPremeditationより適切かと思います。
